medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 weeks ago with less severe pain in the RUQ and epigastrum, worsening over the past three days to sharp, stabbing epigastric pain that came on suddenly last night at approximately midnight. Pain is continuous and has worsened, described as severe, diffuse, with episodes of nausea and non-bilious emesis. Symptoms are worsened by movement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Depression, PTSD, gastritis, history of GSW to chest leading to sternotomy and exploratory laparotomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mostly unknown, noted family history of diabetes.
medical_history.social_history: Heavy drinking (~10 beers) on weekends, history of heavier alcohol use. No recent travel.
